pullRequest.body:
We add the computation of the residue of the completed and non-completed Riemann zeta functions at `s = 1`. 

---

See [this zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Residue.20of.20the.20Riemann.20zeta.20function).

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

bors merge
You may need to `Open Topology` for the neighborhood notation.
I don't think so – there's `open scoped Topology` at the head of the file. It compiles ok on my machine, so there shouldn't be any imports missing.
OK. I copied the new stuff into a test file opening what `#where` in the original file said, but apparently `#where` does not show `Open scoped ...` stuff.

```suggestion
  · rw [(by simp : 𝓝 (0 : ℂ) = 𝓝 ((1 - 1) * (1 / 1)))]
```

Slightly shorter:
```suggestion
  · refine this.congr' <| (eventually_ne_nhdsWithin one_ne_zero).mp (eventually_of_forall ?_)
```

```suggestion
  · have : (π : ℂ) ^ (1 / 2 : ℂ) ≠ 0 :=
      fun h ↦ ofReal_ne_zero.mpr pi_ne_zero ((cpow_eq_zero_iff _ _).mp h).1
    field_simp
```

```suggestion
  · have := fun h ↦ ofReal_ne_zero.mpr pi_ne_zero ((cpow_eq_zero_iff _ (1 / 2)).mp h).1
```
haveI means have + inline, it should basically never be necessary in proofs
OK, I had some vague notion that it was slightly faster to compile than regular `have` (but even if so, the speed gain will clearly be barely noticeable in this proof). Happy to take it out again.

If you find a compelling example of this please report it on the zulip, I imagine people would be interested in trying to understand if something is at fault, as far as I understand there shouldn't be a big difference (but of course my understanding could be the thing at fault!)

I don't think you need `haveI` here. (My understanding is that `I` stands for "inline", but there is no occurrence of `this` that would make sense being inlined.)
```suggestion
  · have := fun h ↦ ofReal_ne_zero.mpr pi_ne_zero ((cpow_eq_zero_iff _ (1 / 2)).mp h).1
```
